conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid based on images to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid starts flowing from points A, B, C, and D; baffles guide its movement; containers E and F are at the bottom.
A (Green) is at the top left, liquid flows downward and slightly to the right.
B (Orange) is at the top center, liquid flows downward.
C (White) is at the top right, liquid flows downward and slightly to the left.
D (Blue) is at the top far right, liquid flows downward and slightly to the left.
Green liquid from A hits pink baffle, deflected right, then hits yellow baffle, guided toward purple baffle (E).
Orange liquid from B hits white baffle, deflected left, may hit gray baffle, guided toward purple baffle (E).
White liquid from C hits orange baffle, deflected left, may hit teal baffle, guided toward purple baffle (E).
Blue liquid from D hits white baffle, deflected left, may hit teal or gray baffle, guided toward purple baffle (E).
Purple baffle (E) is slightly left and center; yellow baffle (F) is to the right.
Liquid paths converge toward center and left, where purple baffle (E) is located.
Baffles' angles and positions funnel liquid toward left and center; purple container (E) is more aligned with paths.
The liquid will flow into container E.
